definition[0]: a large curved container with a flat top and bottom, made of wood or metal, and used for storing beer, wine etc
example[0]: The wine is aged in oak barrels.
definition[1]: a unit of measurement for oil, equal to 159 litres
definition[2]: the part of a gun that the bullets are fired through
definition[3]: to move very fast, especially in an uncontrolled way
example[3]: A vehicle barreled out of a shopping center and crashed into the side of my car.
definition[4]: a large round container with a flat top and bottom, used for storing and carrying liquids such as oil and beer
definition[5]: an amount of a liquid contained in a barrel, used as unit of measurement, especially in the oil industry
example[4]: There were fears that the price of crude would drop as far as $15 a barrel.
example[5]: The country produces more than 650,000 barrels per day of crude oil.
